Dense Fog Envelops Delhi-NCR Again, AQI Drops To "Severe" Category - NDTV
summary:
Dense Fog Envelops North India, Over 150 Flights Delayed In Delhi

Publication Date: January 10, 2025 Source: NDTV

A thick blanket of fog affected visibility in the Delhi-NCR region, leading to significant travel disruptions this morning, including delays for over 150 flights and 26 trains.

  • Visibility reduced to zero, causing delays averaging 41 minutes for flights.
  • The Delhi International Airport Limited (DIAL) reported impacts on flight departures but assured CAT III-compliant flights could still operate.
  • The India Meteorological Department issued a fog warning for North India, spanning Punjab, Haryana, and Rajasthan.
  • Delhi's air quality index (AQI) was severe at 408, necessitating implementation of Stage 3 curbs under the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP).
  • Temperatures in Delhi were recorded between 6 and 20 degrees Celsius.
“Hundreds of flights and trains have been cancelled or delayed due to thick fog in the past few weeks in North India.”

This weather event highlights the ongoing issues with air travel and pollution in the region as winter weather impacts visibility and health.
newTitle: Dense Fog Disrupts Travel in North India

Four Indians accused in Nijjar murder case released from custody in Canada - The Times of India
summary:
Four Indians Accused in Nijjar Murder Case Released From Custody in Canada

Publication Date: [Date Not Provided] Source: Times of India

Four Indian nationals, who were accused in the Nijjar murder case, have been released from custody in Canada, generating significant attention.

  • The accusations were related to the murder of Hardeep Singh Nijjar.
  • The case has implications for international relations between India and Canada.
  • The release has sparked debates on legal processes and diplomatic tensions.
“This release highlights the complexities involved in international legal jurisdictions.”

The release of these individuals marks a notable development in the ongoing diplomatic strains related to the case.

Parvesh Verma hits back at Arvind Kejriwal: 'Gripped with fear of...' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Parvesh Verma said Arvind Kejriwal would soon start blaming the electronic voting machines for his defeat.

Date: Jan 09, 2025 10:55 PM IST
Source: Hindustan Times

In a heated exchange, BJP candidate Parvesh Verma criticized Aam Aadmi Party leader Arvind Kejriwal, stating that Kejriwal is fearful of losing in the upcoming elections and is using voter list discrepancies as an excuse.

  • Verma accuses Kejriwal of being gripped by fear of electoral defeat.
  • Kejriwal raised concerns about irregularities in the voter registration process for the New Delhi assembly.
  • Kejriwal reported that 5.5% of the New Delhi assembly votes were registered in just 22 days, suggesting possible fraud.
  • Verma claims that Kejriwal's popularity is declining among voters in New Delhi.
"Arvind Kejriwal is scared. The fear of losing has gripped him... Soon, he will start blaming EVMs for his defeat." - Parvesh Verma

The tension between the two leaders highlights the contentious atmosphere leading up to the elections as both parties prepare for a fierce electoral battle in New Delhi.
newTitle: Parvesh Verma Responds to Kejriwal's Allegations Amid Election Tensions

'Left My Brother Within 10 Days': IIM Graduate Narrates Ordeal Over Sister-In-Law's Extortion Bid - News18
summary:
IIM Graduate Shares Ordeal Of Sister-In-Law's Extortion: Lost Jobs, Family Suffered Post 10-day Marriage

Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: News18

Amid the ongoing investigation into the suicide of Bengaluru techie Atul Subhash, Prathyusha Challa, an IIM Ahmedabad graduate, shares her family's traumatic experience with alleged extortion by her former sister-in-law.

  • Her brother married a woman from Rajahmundry in 2019, but the marriage lasted only 10 days.
  • The video detailing their ordeal gained significant traction on social media.
  • Challa mentioned that her sister-in-law misbehaved and threatened suicide to extort money from her family.
  • After the marriage ended, the sister-in-law filed a case against them without an investigation.
  • The pending legal case has significantly affected Challa's professional opportunities.
“During the 10 days she stayed with us, she continuously threatened us that she would commit suicide. This was clearly an extortion plan by my sister-in-law.”

The share of this video has prompted discussions about the issues surrounding arranged marriages and gender biases in legal frameworks.
newTitle: IIM Graduate Discusses Family's Disturbing Experience with Sister-In-Law's Extortion

title: ‘Obscene remarks’ against actor Honey Rose: Kerala court sends businessman Boby Chemmanur to 14-day judicial custody - The Indian Express
summary:
Kerala Court Sends Boby Chemmanur to Judicial Custody Over Obscene Remarks Against Honey Rose

Date: January 9, 2025   |   Source: The Indian Express

A magistrate court in Kochi remanded businessman Boby Chemmanur to judicial custody for 14 days following his arrest on charges of making obscene remarks about actor Honey Rose.

  • Chemmanur was arrested after the actor filed a complaint against him.
  • He was booked under sections of the BNS and IT Act.
  • The court denied bail, citing substantial evidence of offense.
  • Honey Rose had previously named 30 individuals for harassment on social media.
  • The actor received support from the Chief Minister and the state police.
“In this modern time, a gun or knife is not necessary to kill a person. Cruel and heinous attacks from a bunch of social media profiles... would be enough,” Honey Rose stated.

The incident highlights the serious issue of online harassment and the consequences it can have for victims, prompting legal action from the affected parties.
newTitle: Kerala Court Sends Boby Chemmanur to Judicial Custody Over Obscene Remarks Against Honey Rose

SpaDeX docking: ISRO arrests drift between satellites - The Hindu
summary:
ISRO Successfully Halts Drift Between SpaDeX Satellites

Date: January 09, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) has managed to halt the drift between its two SpaDeX satellites, initially scheduled for a docking experiment that was postponed due to unexpected drift distances.

  • ISRO announced that the drift has been arrested, with plans to move closer to each other.
  • The docking experiment was delayed as the drift between the satellites exceeded expectations.
  • Initial plans for docking were set for January 7, then postponed to January 9.
  • No new date for the docking experiment has been provided yet by ISRO.
“SpaDeX Docking Update: The drift has been arrested and spacecraft put in a slow drift course to move closer to each other.” - ISRO

In conclusion, while the immediate docking has been delayed, ISRO continues to work towards successful coordination of the SpaDeX satellites.
newTitle: ISRO Successfully Halts Drift Between SpaDeX Satellites

title: 'Why Arvind Kejriwal is not wearing white cap anymore': Alka Lamba takes dig at AAP chief - Hindustan Times
summary:
Why Arvind Kejriwal is not wearing white cap anymore: Alka Lamba takes dig at AAP chief

Date: Jan 09, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

In a recent statement, Alka Lamba, Congress candidate in Kalkaji, criticized Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's leadership, claiming he is losing public support ahead of the upcoming Delhi elections.

  • Lamba questions Kejriwal's abandonment of the symbolic 'white cap'.
  • Claims that Kejriwal is soliciting support from chief ministers of other states.
  • Accuses AAP of acting as the 'B team' of BJP in Delhi.
  • Forecasts that Kejriwal could face legal troubles soon.
  • Highlights that the Delhi assembly election is scheduled for December 5.
“Today, the former CM (Arvind Kejriwal) is seeking support from the Chief Ministers of other states to save his ship instead of asking for votes based on his work.”

As the election approaches, Lamba asserts that the Congress party is gaining trust among the people of Delhi.
newTitle: Alka Lamba Questions Arvind Kejriwal's Leadership as Delhi Elections Approach
